knimeNode.name: Scripting
knimeNode.shortDescription: Executes a user-defined Scijava Command script.

fullDescription.intro: Scijava Commands are a flexible interface for processing code. They are a superclass of ImageJ plugins and can now be executed and coded directly in KNIME!

tab.name: Script Editor
tab.option: A built-in script editor in which the script for this node is directly editable.

Below the main editor is the column input mapping table. This is where you can assign columns of the input table to inputs of your Scijava Command class.
Add a mapping with the big "+" button and then change its column by clicking on the column name in the newly created row. To remove a mapping use the "-" button.
In case you do not want to remove the mapping, you can deactivate it by disabling the check box in the "Active" column. Deactivated mappings will not be used and can easily be reactivated later, if needed again.

The input column list shows the currently available columns in the table assigned to the ScriptingNode input port. You can easily add column to input mappings from here by double clicking on the column.
